steps.title: Gather your tools and materials.
steps.content: Gather your tools and materials. You will need clear craft beads, a metal file, baking tray, aluminum foil, small ice cube sized boxes, a utility knife, and an oven.

steps.title: Fold a sheet of aluminum foil several times until it's thick.
steps.content: Fold a sheet of aluminum foil several times until it's thick.

steps.title: Place the small box on the foil and neatly wrap it around securely.
steps.content: Place the small box on the foil and neatly wrap it around securely. It's important to securely wrap the box to avoid leakage when melting the beads.

steps.title: Mold the box twice as tall as your finished ice cube.
steps.content: Mold the box twice as tall as your finished ice cube. When the ice cubes bake you'll want them to have plenty of room to form, so it's important to keep the mold tall. Make an opening on one face of the box.so you'll have an area to pour the beads in. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Carefully unfold the foil off the box, but not folding all the way through.
steps.content: Carefully unfold the foil off the box, but not folding all the way through. After removing the foil you will have a finished mold to use when it's time to make the fake ice.

steps.title: Repeat the same steps to make more molds for multiple ice cubes.
steps.content: Repeat the same steps to make more molds for multiple ice cubes.

steps.title: Preheat the oven to 450째 Fahrenheit (232째 Celsius).
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 450째 Fahrenheit (232째 Celsius).

steps.title: Pour the clear beads in each opening in the foil molds.
steps.content: Pour the clear beads in each opening in the foil molds.

steps.title: Place the molds on a baking tray standing straight.
steps.content: Place the molds on a baking tray standing straight.

steps.title: Allow the fake ice to bake for about 30 minutes, until the beads melt
steps.content: Allow the fake ice to bake for about 30 minutes, until the beads melt

steps.title: Remove the fake ice from the oven and carefully peel off the foil.
steps.content: Remove the fake ice from the oven and carefully peel off the foil. Take extreme caution, the molds and foil will be hot.

steps.title: Leave the fake ice on a plate to sit until they're cool enough to touch.
steps.content: Leave the fake ice on a plate to sit until they're cool enough to touch.

steps.title: Using the knife and metal file, shave off the extra lingering pieces.
steps.content: Using the knife and metal file, shave off the extra lingering pieces. Carefully shave off an excess foil on the edges or corners to help form a smooth, shiny surface on the fake ice.

steps.title: Understand how it works.
steps.content: Understand how it works. When you place the clear beads in the oven, it melts and turns into a clear color. When it's placed in the mold, the shape resemble an ice cube shape once baked and cooled. This creates the fake ice structure. [2] X Research source
